meanings.definition: Underspins: to support or form the basis of something
meanings.sent1: The strong foundation underspins the entire building.
meanings.sent2: Her dedication to her work underspins her success.
meanings.sent3: The secret ingredient that underspins the recipe is love.
meanings.sent4: Trust is the invisible thread that underspins all relationships.
meanings.sent5: The roots of the tree underspin its towering presence.

meanings.definition: Underspins: the underlying or fundamental aspect of something
meanings.sent1: The underspins of the theory are often overlooked.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the underspins of the problem is crucial for solving it.
meanings.sent3: The underspins of the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: The underspins of her character revealed a depth previously unseen.
meanings.sent5: The underspins of nature's beauty are found in its simplicity.
